title: GitHub's Move to MySQL Row-Based Replication
summary: How GitHub scaled MySQL to handle billions of queries daily while maintaining 99.99% uptime.
content:
Case Study: GitHub and MySQL Scale

GitHub powers one of the world's largest code collaboration platforms, serving tens of millions of developers. Despite NoSQL alternatives, GitHub chose to scale MySQL to meet its needs.

Engineering Approach

GitHub invested heavily in MySQL tooling: Vitess for horizontal sharding, ProxySQL for connection pooling, and GitHub-Backup for reliable backups. They contributed extensively to the MySQL community.

Results

GitHub's MySQL cluster handles billions of queries per day with sub-millisecond query times. Their investment in operational expertise allowed them to squeeze extraordinary performance from a relational database.

Key Learnings

The 'right' database is the one your team understands deeply. Operational excellence often beats architectural novelty. Invest in tooling around your chosen database.
